components.description: The letter D, which can be used as part of a regional indicator pair to create emoji flags for various countries.
components.title: Regional Indicator Symbol Letter D

components.description: The letter E, which can be used as part of a regional indicator pair to create emoji flags for various countries.
components.title: Regional Indicator Symbol Letter E

description: The flag for Germany, which may show as the letters DE on some platforms
title: Flag: Germany

emoji_net_data.definition: The flag for Germany, which may show as the lettersÂ DEÂ on some platforms The Flag for Germany emoji is a sequence of the ?? Regional Indicat http://emojipedia.org/flag-for-germany/
emoji_net_data.name: Germany

bn:13778626a: From or in the countryside or connected with it.
Of, from or pertaining to the countryside (adjective).

bn:00103560a: Of or relating to the German people.
Of or pertaining to or characteristic of Germany or its people or language
Of or relating to Germany, Germans, or the German language.
Of, in or relating to the German language.

bn:00083885v: To cause to move back and forth repeatedly.
To move or swing back and forth.
Move or swing back and forth
To move or swing a weapon back and forth, particularly if demonstrating skill.

bn:03570453n: The flag of Germany is a tricolor consisting of three equal horizontal bands displaying the national colors of Germany: black, red, and gold.

bn:00026684n: Germany, officially the Federal Republic of Germany, is a federal parliamentary republic in western-central Europe consisting of 16 constituent states, which retain limited sovereignty.
A central European country, with capital Berlin.
A republic in central Europe; split into East Germany and West Germany after World War II and reunited in 1990
The country in Central Europe of which Berlin is the current and historical capital city. Current official name: Federal Republic of Germany (Bundesrepublik Deutschland).
Germany, officially the Federal Republic of Germany, is a sovereign country located in Eurasia.

bn:00034960n: Emblem usually consisting of a rectangular piece of cloth of distinctive design
A flag is a piece of fabric with a distinctive design that is used as a symbol, as a signaling device, or as decoration.
A piece of cloth, often decorated with an emblem, used as a visual signal or symbol.
Piece of fabric with a distinctive design

bn:00040293n: Any of a group of West Germanic languages.
German is a West Germanic language.
German is a Germanic language spoken in various European countries, notably Germany, Austria, and Switzerland. language
The standard German language; developed historically from West Germanic
A speaker of the German language.
The standard variety of the German language spoken and written in Germany, Austria and part of Switzerland, where it is also an official language.

The High German languages or High German dialects comprise the varieties of German spoken south of the Benrath and Uerdingen isoglosses in central and southern Germany, Austria, Liechtenstein, Switzerland, and Luxembourg as well as in neighboring portions of Belgium and the Netherlands, France, Italy, and Poland.
A linguistic general term for the High German languages and dialects, as opposed to Lower German.
An Indo-European language, primarily spoken in Germany, Austria, Liechtenstein, South Tyrol, Switzerland and a small part of Belgium.
An Indo-European (Indo-Germanic) language, primarily spoken in Germany, Austria, Liechtenstein, South Tyrol, Switzerland, Luxembourg and a small part of Belgium.

In a sense that it is an area which belongs (or belonged) to a count (German Graf). However, administrative districts that have never belonged to a count, which would also be called counties in English-speaking countries, are not called Grafschaft in German.

bn:00023236n: The collective body of a nation or state as politically organized, or as exercising political functions.
The territory of a nation, especially an independent nation state or formerly independent nation; a political entity asserting ultimate authority over a geographical area.

Nations is often used synonymously with ethnic group, but although ethnicity is now one of the most important aspects of cultural or social identity for the members of most nations, people with the same ethnic origin may live in different nation-states and be treated as members of separate nations for that reason.
Political organisation with a centralized independent government
An organized political community, living under a government
Nation has various meanings, and the meaning has changed over time.
A state is an organized community living under one government.
A political entity asserting ultimate authority over a geographical area.

A people permanently occupying a fixed territory bound together by common law, habits and custom into one body politic exercising, through the medium of an organized government, independent sovereignty and control over all persons and things within its boundaries, unless or until authority is ceded to a federation or union of other states.
The people who live in a nation or country
A politically organized body of people under a single government
A state is a nonphysical juridical entity of the international legal system that is represented by one centralized government that has supreme independent authority over a geographic area.
The geographic area under the control of a political state.

note: This emoji was found in merged_emojis_before_fluentui but not in FluentUI
